summary: This is a civil complaint filed by a plaintiff using the pseudonym 'Mary Doe' against the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and an associate identified as 'Ghislaine Maxwell'. The plaintiff alleges she was sexually abused by Epstein starting at age 16 in 2004, facilitated by Maxwell, and details a pattern of manipulation, coercion, and abuse at Epstein's New York townhouse. The complaint seeks damages for battery, assault, and intentional infliction of emotional distress.

persons.name: Mary Doe
persons.context: Plaintiff using a pseudonym who alleges Jeffrey Epstein sexually abused her starting when she was 16 years old in 2004, leading to severe psychological trauma.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier accused of sexually abusing the plaintiff when she was a minor, using manipulation, threats, and payments.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Named as a defendant in his capacity as an executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, held liable for Epstein's alleged acts.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Named as a defendant in his capacity as an executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, held liable for Epstein's alleged acts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as Epstein's assistant who allegedly played an integral role in facilitating his sexual abuse of the plaintiff and other underage girls by scheduling appointments and handling logistics.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Epstein claimed to be 'best friends' with, using the connection to impress the plaintiff.

persons.name: Mariann Meier Wang
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP who signed the complaint representing the plaintiff.

persons.name: Daniel Mullkoff
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP listed as representing the plaintiff.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney from Allred, Maroko & Goldberg listed as representing the plaintiff.

connections.description: Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused, manipulated, and threatened Mary Doe starting when she was 16.
Maxwell is identified as Epstein's assistant and scheduler who allegedly facilitated his sexual abuse operation.
Maxwell allegedly scheduled appointments, wired money, and witnessed abuse, facilitating Epstein's access to the plaintiff.
Epstein claimed to the plaintiff that he and President Clinton were 'best friends' and used photos of him to impress her.
Both are co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, named as defendants in this lawsuit.

events.title: First meeting with Epstein
events.description: Mary Doe, age 16, first meets Jeffrey Epstein at his Manhattan townhouse after an introduction from a woman connected to modeling. The initial encounter involves a massage and a cash payment.

events.title: Alleged rape by Epstein
events.description: Epstein allegedly rapes Mary Doe in his townhouse massage room when she is 16 years old.

events.title: First meeting with Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Mary Doe first meets Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein's assistant, who begins scheduling her appointments with Epstein.

events.title: Staying in Epstein's apartment
events.description: Epstein arranges for Mary Doe, then 17, to stay in an apartment he owns close to his townhouse.

events.title: Final encounter and realization
events.description: Mary Doe is sexually assaulted by Epstein for the last time. Upon leaving, she sees another young girl entering the townhouse, leading to her realization that she was part of a rotation of girls and triggering her departure from New York.

events.title: Epstein calls plaintiff's parents
events.description: After Mary Doe leaves New York, Epstein tracks down her parents' home phone number and calls. Her mother tells him to date women his own age and threatens to call the police.

events.title: Epstein's arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is arrested in July 2019, giving the plaintiff brief hope for justice.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein dies, leaving the plaintiff with a sense that he evaded justice.

events.title: Lawsuit filed
events.description: Mary Doe files this civil complaint in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's townhouse)
keyFacts: The plaintiff, using the pseudonym Mary Doe, alleges Jeffrey Epstein began sexually abusing her when she was 16 years old in the summer of 2004.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a defendant and is alleged to have been an integral part of Epstein's operation, scheduling appointments, wiring money, and witnessing abuse.

The complaint details a pattern of manipulation where Epstein used his wealth, connections to powerful people (like Bill Clinton and celebrities), and promises of career help to gain control over the plaintiff.

The plaintiff's final encounter with Epstein occurred around Thanksgiving 2005 when she was 17, after which she saw another young girl entering his townhouse, leading to her realization and departure from New York.
The lawsuit was filed on November 20, 2019, against the executors of Epstein's estate and Ghislaine Maxwell, seeking damages for battery, assault, and intentional infliction of emotional distress.
